cards.name: Karn Liberated
cards.text:
+4: Target player exiles a card from his or her hand.
−3: Exile target permanent.
−14: Restart the game, leaving in exile all non-Aura permanent cards exiled with Karn Liberated. Then put those cards onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Apostle's Blessing
cards.text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
Target artifact or creature you control gains protection from artifacts or from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "We are Mirrodin's children. We will reclaim her—one scrap at a time, if we have to."
cards.name: Auriok Survivors
cards.text: When Auriok Survivors enters the battlefield, you may return target Equipment card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If you do, you may attach it to Auriok Survivors.

cards.text:
When Blade Splicer enters the battlefield, put a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
Golem creatures you control have first strike.

cards.text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
Defender

cards.flavor: Venser wondered if it could still be called a teleportation spell if the destination is oblivion.
cards.name: Dispatch
cards.text:
Tap target creature.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, exile that creature.

cards.flavor:
"A display of humility is required of those who still possess such frailties."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
cards.name: Due Respect
cards.text:
Permanents enter the battlefield tapped this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "The Gitaxians whisper among themselves of other worlds. If they exist, we must bring Phyrexia's magnificence to them."

cards.text:
Vigilance

cards.flavor:

—Izathel, priest of the Annex

cards.text:

Enchant creature

cards.flavor:
"Skin is the prison of the blessed and the stronghold of the heretic."

cards.text:

cards.flavor: Mirrans were broken down and rebuilt, made to be loyal servants of the force they had fought.

cards.flavor: Just one drop of the glistening oil can eventually stain even a soul as stalwart as a loxodon's beyond redemption.

"We are a single entity. Dissenters must be sutured into the Orthodoxy."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
Creatures can't attack you or a planeswalker you control unless their controller pays {W/P} for each of those creatures.

cards.name: Phyrexian Unlife
cards.text:
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
As long as you have 0 or less life, all damage is dealt to you as though its source had infect. (Damage is dealt to you in the form of poison counters.)

cards.flavor:

cards.flavor: Underling Ethu's 263rd report read simply "Yes, my lord. Overwhelmingly, my lord." This marked the end of the Mirran-Phyrexian War.

cards.text: You gain life equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield plus the number of artifacts on the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"My world is corrupted beyond cleansing. I must prevent this from happening to other worlds."

cards.flavor: "Beg me for life, and I will fill you with the glory of Phyrexian perfection."
cards.name: Glistener Elf
cards.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.flavor: "Our ancestors adapted to this world of metal. Just as they did, we will adapt to this world of evil."
cards.name: Greenhilt Trainee
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if Greenhilt Trainee's power is 4 or greater.

cards.flavor: A substantial portion of Vorinclex's forces became fuel for the rest.
cards.name: Leeching Bite
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Maul Splicer
cards.text:
When Maul Splicer enters the battlefield, put two 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Golem creatures you control have trample.

cards.flavor: Once a pariah, now Mirrodin's greatest hope.
cards.name: Melira, Sylvok Outcast
cards.text:
You can't get poison counters.
Creatures you control can't have -1/-1 counters placed on them.
Creatures your opponents control lose infect.

cards.flavor:
"Sympathy is for weaklings. Whoever survives, wins."
—Benzir, archdruid of Temple Might
cards.name: Mutagenic Growth
cards.text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"I wish I could take credit for it, but nature progresses on its own, just the way it should."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
cards.name: Mycosynth Fiend
cards.text: Mycosynth Fiend gets +1/+1 for each poison counter your opponents have.

cards.flavor:
"Dead or alive, my creations are stronger than Jin-Gitaxias's septic minions."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
cards.name: Noxious Revival
cards.text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Put target card from a graveyard on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Phyrexian Swarmlord
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 1/1 green Insect creature token with infect onto the battlefield for each poison counter your opponents have.

cards.flavor: Vorinclex had no grand plan. The oil did its own work, evolving creatures into worthy predators.
cards.name: Rotted Hystrix
Spinebiter
cards.text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
You may have Spinebiter assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.flavor:
"We do not need beakers and vials to test our predators."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
cards.name: Thundering Tanadon
cards.text:
({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)
Trample

cards.name: Triumph of the Hordes
cards.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample and infect. (Creatures with infect deal damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.flavor: To secure a place in Phyrexia's ranks, they hunted their surviving kin.
cards.name: Viridian Betrayers
cards.text: Viridian Betrayers has infect as long as an opponent is poisoned. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.flavor:
"In the midst of horror beyond imagining, I still see things that lift my heart."
—Ezuri
cards.name: Viridian Harvest
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
When enchanted artifact is put into a graveyard, you gain 6 life.

cards.flavor:
"For every one that falls, ten shall rise. The revelation of New Phyrexia is at hand."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
cards.name: Vital Splicer
cards.text:
When Vital Splicer enters the battlefield, put a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
{1}: Regenerate target Golem you control.

cards.name: Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.
Whenever an opponent taps a land for mana, that land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: "As long as my hand holds a blade, there's hope for a pure Mirrodin once again."
cards.name: Jor Kadeen, the Prevailer
cards.text:
First strike
Metalcraft — Creatures you control get +3/+0 as long as you control three or more artifacts.

cards.flavor: With or without witnesses, the suns continued their prismatic dance.
cards.name: Alloy Myr
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Batterskull
cards.text:
Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, put a 0/0 black Germ creature token onto the battlefield, then attach this to it.)
Equipped creature gets +4/+4 and has vigilance and lifelink.
{3}: Return Batterskull to its owner's hand.
Equip {5}

cards.flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for inscribing our souls with subservience, to reinforce the sacred order."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude
cards.name: Blinding Souleater
cards.text: {W/P}, {T}: Tap target creature. ({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)

cards.name: Caged Sun
cards.text:
As Caged Sun enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Creatures you control of the chosen color get +1/+1.
Whenever a land's ability adds one or more mana of the chosen color to your mana pool, add one additional mana of that color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Conversion Chamber
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard. Put a charge counter on Conversion Chamber.
{2}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Conversion Chamber: Put a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"It's the last thing we can call our own."
—Minhu, Mirran resistance
cards.name: Darksteel Relic
cards.text: Indestructible (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this artifact.)

cards.flavor: Now etched only with the scars of phyresis.
cards.name: Etched Monstrosity
cards.text:
Etched Monstrosity enters the battlefield with five -1/-1 counters on it.
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}, Remove five -1/-1 counters from Etched Monstrosity: Target player draws three cards.

cards.name: Gremlin Mine
cards.text:
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Gremlin Mine: Gremlin Mine deals 4 damage to target artifact creature.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Gremlin Mine: Remove up to four charge counters from target noncreature artifact.

cards.flavor: Drawn by power, fueled by conquest.
cards.name: Hex Parasite
cards.text: {X}{B/P}: Remove up to X counters from target permanent. For each counter removed this way, Hex Parasite gets +1/+0 until end of turn. ({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)

cards.flavor: Originally created to harvest blinkmoths, the hovermyr are now the silent observers of a dying world.
cards.name: Hovermyr
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for melting the sinful that we may be reminded of our own insignificance."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude
cards.name: Immolating Souleater
cards.text: {R/P}: Immolating Souleater gets +1/+0 until end of turn. ({R/P} can be paid with either {R} or 2 life.)

cards.flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for culling our sick so that the strong may earn their triumphs."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude
cards.name: Insatiable Souleater
cards.text: {G/P}: Insatiable Souleater gains trample until end of turn. ({G/P} can be paid with either {G} or 2 life.)

cards.flavor:
"Attrition is the answer. Starve them, and let their despair be their undoing."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One
cards.name: Isolation Cell
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, that player loses 2 life unless he or she pays {2}.

cards.flavor: If it possesses an ability to understand and appreciate life, it has never shown it.
cards.name: Kiln Walker
cards.text: Whenever Kiln Walker attacks, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lashwrithe
cards.text:
Living weapon (When this Equipment enters the battlefield, put a 0/0 black Germ creature token onto the battlefield, then attach this to it.)
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each Swamp you control.
Equip {B/P}{B/P} ({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)

cards.flavor:
"Let go of your memories and be reborn."
—Argent Etchings, plate 106, passage 27
cards.name: Mindcrank
cards.text: Whenever an opponent loses life, that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard. (Damage dealt by sources without infect causes loss of life.)

cards.flavor: The oil created the mycosynth. The mycosynth created New Phyrexia.
cards.name: Mycosynth Wellspring
cards.text: When Mycosynth Wellspring enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Two kinds of myr survive: the powerful and those that stay close by them.
cards.name: Myr Superion
cards.text: Spend only mana produced by creatures to cast Myr Superion.

cards.name: Necropouncer
Omen Machine
cards.text:
Players can't draw cards.
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player exiles the top card of his or her library. If it's a land card, the player puts it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, the player casts it without paying its mana cost if able.

cards.name: Pestilent Souleater
cards.text: {B/P}: Pestilent Souleater gains infect until end of turn. ({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life. A creature with infect deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.flavor: An invasion weapon of ages past, the glistening oil contained the blueprints of countless atrocities.
cards.name: Phyrexian Hulk

cards.flavor:
"Tools and artisans can be destroyed, but the act of creation is inviolate."
—Elspeth Tirel
cards.name: Pristine Talisman
cards.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Shrine of Boundless Growth
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a green spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Boundless Growth.
{T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Boundless Growth: Add {1} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Shrine of Boundless Growth.

cards.name: Shrine of Burning Rage
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a red spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Burning Rage.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Burning Rage: Shrine of Burning Rage deals damage equal to the number of charge counters on it to target creature or player.

cards.name: Shrine of Limitless Power
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a black spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Limitless Power.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Limitless Power: Target player discards a card for each charge counter on Shrine of Limitless Power.

cards.name: Shrine of Loyal Legions
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a white spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Loyal Legions.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Loyal Legions: Put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield for each charge counter on Shrine of Loyal Legions.

cards.name: Shrine of Piercing Vision
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a blue spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Piercing Vision.
{T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Piercing Vision: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of charge counters on Shrine of Piercing Vision. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Sickleslicer

cards.flavor:
"You have an unhealthy attachment to your selfhood. I can help you with that."
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis
cards.name: Soul Conduit
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Two target players exchange life totals.

cards.flavor:
"Let's show Vorinclex that progress doesn't always need teeth or claws."
—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis
cards.name: Spellskite
cards.text: {U/P}: Change a target of target spell or ability to Spellskite. ({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)

cards.flavor: Without a foe to focus on, the machine priests had time to indulge in new sciences.
cards.name: Surge Node
cards.text:
Surge Node enters the battlefield with six charge counters on it.
{1}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Surge Node: Put a charge counter on target artifact.

cards.name: Sword of War and Peace

cards.flavor:
"Phyrexia is certainly dangerous, but I have to admire some of its innovations."
—Tezzeret
cards.name: Torpor Orb
cards.text: Creatures entering the battlefield don't cause abilities to trigger.

cards.flavor:
"We thank the souleaters for surveilling our lives that we may be preserved from our own ignorance."
—Drones' hymn of gratitude
cards.name: Trespassing Souleater
cards.text: {U/P}: Trespassing Souleater can't be blocked this turn. ({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)

cards.flavor:
"The partisans have unearthed a strange artifact. None know its origin, but it gives them hope of a life beyond."
—Elspeth's journal
cards.name: Unwinding Clock
cards.text: Untap all artifacts you control during each other player's untap step.

cards.flavor:
"So even the heart of our world has succumbed."
—Koth of the Hammer
cards.name: Phyrexia's Core
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: You gain 1 life.
